alert.note: Alert for Allen; Greenwood; Neosho; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 9:05AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Wilson, northern Neosho, Woodson, southeastern Greenwood and Allen Counties through 1000 AM CDT... At 905 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Yates Center to 6 miles south of Hamilton. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chanute, Iola, Humboldt, Yates Center, La Harpe, Gas, Toronto, Hamilton, Buffalo, Fall River, Neosho Falls, Benedict, Virgil, Coyville, Bassett, Rose, Piqua, Toronto Lake, Batesville and Petrolia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for southeastern Kansas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for southeastern Kansas.
